recipes.title: Smoked salmon & avocado

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Grüner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Chateau Ste. Michelle Pinot Gris. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 13 dollars.

productMatches.title: Chateau Ste. Michelle Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Mild winter and spring weather continued into a long, warm, dry and stable growing season in 2001. September harvest conditions were ideal with very warm, clear days and cool nights."Fresh pear, honeydew melon and mandarin orange aromas and flavors combine with chamomile tea, honeysuckle and assorted floral characteristics..." according to winemaker, Erik Olsen. This wine pairs well with shellfish, cream-based dishes, cheese & fruit.

recipes.instructions: Stone and peel the avocados, cut into chunks and toss in half the lemon juice. Twist and fold the smoked salmon pieces onto serving plates, then scatter with the avocado. Cover and chill for up to 1 hr until ready to serve.Mix together the tarragon, crème fraîche and remaining lemon juice. Drizzle over the salmon, scatter with the capers and serve straight away with wholemeal or soda bread.

steps.step: Stone and peel the avocados, cut into chunks and toss in half the lemon juice. Twist and fold the smoked salmon pieces onto serving plates, then scatter with the avocado. Cover and chill for up to 1 hr until ready to serve.
Mix together the tarragon, crème fraîche and remaining lemon juice.
Drizzle over the salmon, scatter with the capers and serve straight away with wholemeal or soda bread.
